Extract period (seasonal) averages from fitted GAM

anlz_avgseason.Rd

Extract period (seasonal) averages from fitted GAM

anlz_avgseason(moddat = NULL, mods = NULL, doystr = 1,
  doyend = 364, ...)

Arguments

moddat

input raw data, one station and paramater
mods

optional list of model objects
doystr

numeric indicating start Julian day for extracting averages
doyend

numeric indicating ending Julian day for extracting averages
...

additional arguments passed to other methods

Value

A data frame of period averages

See also

Other analyze: anlz_backtrans, anlz_fit, anlz_gam, anlz_perchg, anlz_prdday, anlz_prd, anlz_smooth, anlz_trans

Examples

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

# fit models with function
tomod <- rawdat %>%
  filter(station %in% 32) %>%
  filter(param %in% 'chl')
if (FALSE) {
anlz_avgseason(tomod, trans = 'boxcox', doystr = 90, doyend = 180)
}
# use previously fitted list of models
trans <- 'boxcox'
mods <- list(
  gam0 = anlz_gam(tomod, mod = 'gam0', trans = trans),
  gam1 = anlz_gam(tomod, mod = 'gam1', trans = trans),
  gam2 = anlz_gam(tomod, mod = 'gam2', trans = trans)
  )
#> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'xts':
#>   method     from
#>   as.zoo.xts zoo 
#> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod':
#>   method            from
#>   as.zoo.data.frame zoo 
#> Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'forecast':
#>   method             from    
#>   fitted.fracdiff    fracdiff
#>   residuals.fracdiff fracdiff
anlz_avgseason(mods = mods, doystr = 90, doyend = 180)
#> # A tibble: 84 x 4
#>    model predicted    se    yr
#>    <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <int>
#>  1 gam0       5.22  1.05  1990
#>  2 gam0       5.31  1.05  1991
#>  3 gam0       5.42  1.05  1992
#>  4 gam0       5.52  1.04  1993
#>  5 gam0       5.63  1.04  1994
#>  6 gam0       5.73  1.04  1995
#>  7 gam0       5.85  1.04  1996
#>  8 gam0       5.96  1.04  1997
#>  9 gam0       6.07  1.04  1998
#> 10 gam0       6.19  1.04  1999
#> # ... with 74 more rows
